data.title: Hangmangled
data.solution:
# https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Whitespace_(programming_language)

eval DATA.read
Whitespace.new(<<PROGRAM).tap(&:parse).interpret
   	 		 	 

    
 
     
		    	
	  	 
 
	  	

 
  

   	
 
 	
	 			 
    	 	 
	  	
	  	  

 	 	 
 
 
	  	
 
 			   	
	   		    	
 
 			   	
	   		     

 
 	

   	 
 
    	      
	  	    
 
		  	
		 		
 
 	  	
	

   		
 
    		    	
	 	    	     
	  
	  	
	

   	  
 

   	 

 	 	 	
   		

 	 	 	
   	 
	   			 
	   	 
	   			 
  	  	 
	  	
		 	 	 
   	 	 
   		   	 
   		 				
   	    	 
	
  	
  	
  	
   
		  		
 	   	 	 
	
  



   	 	
   		 		

   		 
    
 
 	
	 						 	  	 
				    	  	 
 
			  	  	
			   	
				  	
	  	  	

   			
   	
	  	 
 
	  	   

 
 		 

   	   
 


	

   	  	
 
    		 		
 
		  	   	
	    	  	 
    
		  	  	 
   	 
	    
			 
 
 			

   	 	 
   	 	 
   		  	 	
   		   		
   		 	  	
   		 		  
   	     	
	
  	
  	
  	
  	
  	
  	  		
 	   	 	 
	
  


PROGRAM
__END__
class Whitespace
  Ops = {
    "  "       => :push,  " \t "   => :copy, " \t\n"   => :slide, "\n  "    => :label,
    "\n \t"    => :call,  "\n \n"  => :jump, "\n\t "   => :jz,    "\n\t\t"  => :jn,
    " \n\n"    => :pop,   " \n "   => :dup,  " \n\t"   => :swap,  "\t   "   => :add,
    "\t  \t"   => :sub,   "\t  \n" => :mul,  "\t \t "  => :div,   "\t \t\t" => :mod,
    "\t\t "    => :store, "\t\t\t" => :load, "\n\t\n"  => :ret,   "\t\n\t " => :ichr,
    "\t\n\t\t" => :inum,  "\t\n  " => :ochr, "\t\n \t" => :onum,  "\n\n\n"  => :exit
  }

  def initialize src
    @src = src.delete "^ \t\n"
  end

  def parse
    @insns = []
    buf = ''
    while c = @src.slice!(0)
      if insn = Ops[buf << c]
        arg = parse_number if Ops.keys.index(buf) < 8
        @insns << [insn, arg].compact
        buf.clear
        arg = nil
      end
    end

    self
  end

  def parse_number
    bin = @src.slice! 0, @src.index(?\n) + 1
    bin[0] = '-' if bin[0] == ?\t
    bin.tr(" \t", "01").to_i 2
  end

  def interpret
    jumps = {}
    @insns.each_with_index do |(op, arg), i|
      jumps[arg] = i if op == :label
    end

    ip, stack, heap, calls = -1, [], {}, []
    while insn = @insns[ip += 1]
      op, arg = insn
      case op
      when :push  ; stack << arg
      when :copy  ; stack << stack[-1 - arg]
      when :slide ; stack[-arg - 1, arg] = []
      when :call  ; calls << ip; ip = jumps[arg]
      when :jump  ; ip = jumps[arg]
      when :jz    ; ip = jumps[arg] if stack.pop == 0
      when :jn    ; ip = jumps[arg] if stack.pop < 0
      when :pop   ; stack.pop
      when :dup   ; stack << stack[-1]
      when :swap  ; stack[-1], stack[-2] = stack[-2], stack[-1]
      when :add   ; stack << stack.pop(2).reduce(:+)
      when :sub   ; stack << stack.pop(2).reduce(:-)
      when :mul   ; stack << stack.pop(2).reduce(:*)
      when :div   ; stack << stack.pop(2).reduce(:/)
      when :mod   ; stack << stack.pop(2).reduce(:%)
      when :store ; k, v = stack.pop(2); heap[k] = v
      when :load  ; stack << heap[stack.pop].to_i
      when :ret   ; ip = calls.pop
      when :ichr  ; heap[stack.pop] = (STDIN.getc || -1).ord
      when :inum  ; heap[stack.pop] = STDIN.gets.to_i
      when :ochr  ; STDOUT << stack.pop.chr
      when :onum  ; STDOUT << stack.pop
      when :exit  ; break
      end
    end
  end
end
data.statement:
Alice and Bob are playing a game of Hangman wherein they each have a go at guessing the letters of a word or phrase until they've revealed the entire thing. Unfortunately, they forgot to keep score during the round and now the rest of the alphabet has been concatenated onto the end of their strings of guesses. They're very competitive and need to know who won (and by how much).

Given the word or phrase they were trying to guess along with their respective guesses (plus all the unguessed letters), determine which player revealed all the letters using the fewest attempts.

<<Notes:>> Alice always goes first, but thankfully Bob has selective amnesia and doesn't remember the solution when he gets the same puzzle that Alice just solved. Some of the phrases contain non-alphabetical characters; these did not need to be guessed by the players as they were revealed at the start of the game.

testCases.title: All sorts of characters
testCases.testIn:
42: the meaning of life, the universe, and everything.
RSTLNEJAGFUXHKMDVIYOBCPQWZ
RSTLNEIGHAFMVDYOUBCJKPQWXZ

testCases.title: All sorts of characters (validator)
testCases.testIn:
42: the meaning of life, the universe, and everything.
RSTLNEIGHAFMVDYOUBCJKPQWXZ
RSTLNEJAGFUXHKMDVIYOBCPQWZ

testCases.title: A dash of cheap profundity
testCases.testIn:
Life is War is Death is Peace
FASETHIRWPLCDBGJKMNOQUVXYZ
ECWLNSPYHRGFJIDTABKMOQUVXZ

testCases.title: Anagrams are people too.
testCases.testIn:
Twelve plus one = eleven plus two.
TSLWOVQGNUEPABCDFHIJKMRXYZ
LETOVNSPUDWABCFGHIJKMQRXYZ

data.constraints: 1 ≤ [[N]] ≤ 60, where [[N]] is the length of the word or phrase
data.stubGenerator:
read phrase:string(61)
read alice:string(27)
read bob:string(27)

write winner
differential
data.inputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> the word or phrase to be guessed
<<Line 2:>> Alice's guesses
<<Line 3:>> Bob's guesses
data.outputDescription:
<<Line 1:>> {{Alice}} or {{Bob}}, whoever revealed all the letters in the word or phrase the most efficiently
<<Line 2:>> the score differential (that is, by how much the winner won)
